intro: Leucopogon atherolepis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in heathlands and woodland areas. Leucopogon atherolepis is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in coastal regions.
